data.title: Bengals vs. Buccaneers: How to watch, TV info, online streaming options, and more
data.meta_description: Here’s how to watch Cincinnati Bengals vs Tampa Bay Buccaneers for their first preseason game.
data.text:
We will get our first look at the 2024 Cincinnati Bengals soon. Well, kind of.

Most starters will barely play, if at all this week when the Bengals host the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. We know quarterback Joe Burrow will play sparingly, so that will be great to see after he missed virtually all of training camp and the preseason last year due to a calf injury.

We may see it be a case-by-case thing with starters getting on the field, or maybe the whole (most of) unit will get a few plays. You shouldn’t expect any players dealing with an injury to be out there, though, such as Sam Hubbard, McKinnley Jackson, and

As with most of the preseason, we will see plenty of the young guys and roster-bubble players show what they have and try and make the team. This year, you might get an extended look at the future with Andrei Iosivas, Charlie Jones, and Jermaine Burton set for big roles when Tee Higgins eventually leaves via free agency next offseason, not to mention someone needing to fill Tyler Boyd’s shoes this season, while Ja’Marr Chase is definitely out amid his hold-in.

Here’s what you need to know for the Bengals’ first football game of the 2024 season!

Cincinnati Bengals (0-0) vs. Tampa Bay Buccaneers (0-0)
